author: Tasha Hegarty
title: This amazing fan edit shows how Pulp Fiction inspired Breaking Bad - Breaking Bad US TV
text: There have been many comparisons between Breaking Bad and Quentin Tarantino's cult film Pulp Fiction, and an amazing fan edit has now shown some of the main connections.From camera shots to scenes and even characters, there are some striking similarities between the two.Breaking Bad // Pulp Fiction from Jorge Luengo Ruiz on Vimeo. Low camera shots of Walter White opening his boot are very similar to Vincent and Jules doing the same in Pulp Fiction.Then there's the striking resemblance between the characters of Jane Margolis (Breaking Bad) and Pulp Fiction's Mia Wallace - same haircuts, similar attitudes and even deaths. The scene where Walt encounters Jesse's hostage, Krazy-8, while he drives past him is close to the scene in Pulp Fiction where Butch rams his car into Marsellus Wallace.Again, Breaking Bad's Hank Schrader and Pulp Fiction's Vincent Vega catching up on their reading on the loo was also difficult to miss.Vince Gilligan clearly took a bit of inspiration from the cult filmmaker when making the AMC hit. It was also revealed recently that Pulp Fiction could have been very different, with Michael Madsen, Johnny Depp and Patricia Arquette lined up for iconic roles.
